str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From haireomai; properly, a choice, i.e. a party or disunion.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of Hebrew origin; a separatist, i.e. Exclusively religious; a Pharisean, i.e. Jewish sectary.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From ek and anistemi; objectively, to produce, i.e. beget; subjectively, to arise, i.e. object.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.
To cut around, circumcise. From peri and the base of tomoteros; to cut around, i.e. to circumcise.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
To notify, command, charge, entreat solemnly. From para and the base of aggelos; to transmit a message, i.e. to enjoin.
From teros; to guard, i.e. To note; by implication, to detain; by extension, to withhold; by extension, to withhold.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.
